text: "Arrow Through Me" is a song by the British–American rock band Wings, released on their 1979 album Back to the Egg.McCartney: Songwriter p. 219 ==Background== "Arrow Through Me", unlike most songs on Back to the Egg, is more pop-oriented than rock-oriented.McCartney: Songwriter p. 204 Ultimate Classic Rock contributor Nick DeRiso compared the keyboard bass line to those of Stevie Wonder and also praised the "inventive undulating polyrhythm" played by drummer Steve Holley. DeRiso rated "Arrow Through Me" to be Wings' 8th greatest song. Billboard Magazine described it as "a light and bouncy midtempo tune with sparse orchestration." ==Personnel== *Paul McCartney – vocals, synth-bass, electric piano, clavinetVigars, Mark. (1979). https://www.the- paulmccartney-project.com/song/arrow-through-me/ *Steve Holley – drums, Flexatone *Howie Casey – horns *Tony Dorsey – horns *Steve Howard – horns *Thaddeus Richard – horns ==Release== It was the A-side of the second US single released from Back to the Egg and peaked at number 29. The B-side was "Old Siam, Sir", which was the A-side of the first UK single. ==Other== The rumour that it inspired ABC's 1982 hit "Poison Arrow" is false, although there are similarities in its music video to that of Wings' "Goodnight Tonight". The song was used with the opening credits of, and as a main melody line through, the 1980 movie Oh! Heavenly Dog, starring Chevy Chase, Jane Seymour and Benji. In 2010, neo-soul artist Erykah Badu sampled "Arrow Through Me" on an album track called "Gone Baby, Don't Be Long" on her CD New Amerykah Part Two (Return of the Ankh). It also appeared in the WKRP in Cincinnati episode "God Talks to Johnny" (1979).My Year of Chevy: One Guy's Journey Through the Filmography of Chevy Chase p. 15 In 2020, the song appeared in episode 2 (track 2) of Hulu's TV series adaptation of Nick Hornby's novel High Fidelity starring Zoe Kravitz. ==Chart history== ===Weekly charts=== {| class="wikitable" |- !Chart (1979) !Peak position |- |Canada RPM Top Singles | style="text-align:center;"|27 |- |US Billboard Hot 100Joel Whitburn's Top Pop Singles 1955-1990 - | style="text- align:center;"|29 |- |US Billboard Adult Contemporary |align="center"|29 |- |US Cash Box Top 100 |align="center"|36 |} ===Year-end charts=== {|class="wikitable" |- !Chart (1979) !Rank |- |Canada (RPM Chart) | style="text-align:center;"|181 |- |US (Joel Whitburn's Pop Annual) | style="text-align:center;"|178 |} ==References== Category:Paul McCartney songs Category:1979 singles Category:1970s ballads Category:Wings (band) songs Category:Songs written by Paul McCartney Category:Columbia Records singles Category:Song recordings produced by Paul McCartney Category:Song recordings produced by Chris Thomas (record producer) Category:Music published by MPL Music Publishing Category:Pop ballads
